page.title: 17The A46 Bypass around Newark
page.content: The public inquiry into the proposed bypass mentions the possibility of flooding in parts of Farndon and East Stoke. If they go ahead they will knock down 34, Castle Gate, Ferryman's House, Newark cricket club ground and the dairy. All these properties have flooded before but now it will be worse and others say it will be too noisy. The Dept of Transport say thwy will build a flood bank to protect 28 houses on Kelham Road. People are divided. Some think that the bypass will be a good thing because there is so much traffic going through Newark. Others think that because of the problem of increased flooding, this is not the right plan.
